etymologies: named after La Grande Chartreuse, the Carthusian monastery near Grenoble, where the liqueur (chartreuse (sense 1)) was first made; chartreuse (sense 2) is an extended use

definitions: a pale green or yellow liqueur made from brandy and aromatic herbs.
shortDefinitions: pale green or yellow liqueur made from brandy and aromatic herbs

definitions: a pale yellow or green color resembling the liqueur chartreuse.
shortDefinitions: pale yellow or green colour resembling liqueur chartreuse

definitions: a dish made in a mold using pieces of meat, vegetables, or (now most often) fruit in jelly.
shortDefinitions: dish made in mould using pieces of meat, game, vegetables, or now most
